title: Space Explorer
description: Journey through the stars and planets!

questions.question: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
questions.explanation: Mars is called the Red Planet because of iron oxide (rust) on its surface that gives it a reddish appearance!

questions.question: The Sun is a star.
questions.explanation: Yes! The Sun is a star - it's the closest star to Earth and gives us light and warmth.

questions.question: How many planets are in our solar system?
questions.explanation: There are 8 planets: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune!

questions.question: Saturn's rings are made of solid rock.
questions.explanation: Saturn's rings are made mostly of ice particles, with some rocky debris and dust mixed in!

questions.question: Which planet is the largest in our solar system?
questions.explanation: Jupiter is so big that over 1,300 Earths could fit inside it!

questions.question: Astronauts grow taller in space.
questions.explanation: Without gravity, the spine can stretch out, making astronauts about 2 inches taller in space!

questions.question: What is the closest planet to the Sun?
questions.explanation: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun, but it's not the hottest - Venus is, because of its thick atmosphere!

questions.question: There is no sound in space.
questions.explanation: Sound needs air (or another medium) to travel through. Space is a vacuum, so it's completely silent!
